resource.chars:
Cuvier refers to this organ in Salpa Tilesii as “l’anneau 
irreguliere qui la termine (la branchie) en arriere.”
In S. Mucronata not perceiving that he has described 
the very same organ under a different form he describes 
the “ciliated sac” as a Testis - The languet he 
calls <s>[text?]<\s> simply “Haken”
M. Milne Edwards figures the “ciliated fossa” as the 
“fossette prebranchiale” in the plates of the last 
(commemorative) edition of Cuviers “Regne Animal”
